Articles.Content:
There used to be another thread like this but it had way too much mud, so im making a new one!

The premise is simple: one person asks a what if question, the other person answers it, and asks a new one!

Sound good?

Okay!

I'll start:

What if the Axis powers in world war 1 had cast-iron riot shields?

Cast Iron would be tainted by association. For decades, it would be outlawed, and not until 50 years after the war would someone finally have a truly good plate of hash browns.

What if all cheese had a chance of spontaneously combusting?

Then it would be used as a weapon.

What if Mars had never been impacted by another protoplanet?

Then my classmate would be a alien

I got 3 What If's

What if nobody made the Nuke

What if Challenger and Columbia did not explode,

What if Challenger was able to do a RTLS

1. If we didn't make the nuke, then the world would have a Japanese empire. Or America would own what Japan is today. Odd enough, I learned about the end of WWII in my History class today.

2. NASA would still be funded a lot.

3. I'm not sure what a RTLS is, though.

On 02/03/2016 at 9:27 PM, legoclone09 said:

3. I'm not sure what a RTLS is, though.

Return To Launch Site

 

Anyway, you didn't ask a question. Someone else please continue.

What if the universe started off with Helium?

Our voices would be high

Say Werner Von Buran went to the Soviets

Then he would indeed be named Werhner Von Buran instead of Von Braun.

What if the Soviets landed on the Moon first?

The extra national pride may have given the soviets enough momentum to prepare a mars mission. Americans would prepare one too, to get back their national pride, and we'd have nuclear-powered spaceships on mars by about 1990. It would be awesome! Maybe.

 

What if we discovered a way to get around the brain-blood-barrier and inject the neurotransmitter chemicals responsible for emotion (dopamine, serotonin, oxytosin, etc.) directly into our brains?

Dictators would be even more powerful.

What if cats and dogs would change roles?

18 minutes ago, ZentroCatson said:

Dictators would be even more powerful.

What if cats and dogs would change roles?

hehehe... I have 4 cats that like to sleep with me... I would need another bed!

Here's one philosophers have pondered for centuries:
What if donuts didn't have holes???

They'd be filled with boston cream and cherry jelly! mmmmm...

What if tomorrow, a massive alien spacecraft appeared above the nearest major city to you?

I would get out some binoculars and look at it from way out here in the suburbs.

What if Earth's rotation rate started speeding up by 50% each day? (Fairly sure this is safe but noticeable acceleration, but it's too late at night to do the math)

Then in ten days it would be a 1 minute day

What if Rock and Roll never died

Then it would be in the trends. Duh. 

What if Germany won the Battle of Britain, let Operation Sea Lion commence, and manage to invade and successfully occupy Britain?

We would all be hailing a certain mustached fellow.

What if all printers decided to rebel and print copies of money to destroy the economy?
Then the economy would be destroyed.

I think if we enedned up sing more power, than the average man could live on a 2 dollar electric bill.

What iif we went to mars not the moon

Then we would blow up our hab like the Martian instead of ending up Apollo 13.

 

what if we we actually nice to Dres? (Dres is my favorite planet so be nice!)

Then Dres would feel less lonely.

What if I'm Pointland?

(what is pointland?) 

What if you where transfered to an alternative universe where the kerbol system was real?

3 hours ago, _PRATTER_ said:

(what is pointland?)

It's a Flatland reference (great book, awful movie!). Pointland is a zero-dimensional universe with a consciousness; it cannot perceive or understand anything outside it's own mind. If you try to tell it there are other beings and other dimensions, it will think the thought originated in it's own mind and will simply dismiss it as nonsense.

4 hours ago, _PRATTER_ said:

What if you where transfered to an alternative universe where the kerbol system was real? 

Then we could talk to aliens easily and also make interstellar ships that can go way faster then what we can do in our universe.

What if the K-Pg event had never happened?

Then there would be an alternate timeline where that did happen. Your stuck in this one though.

 

What if the Jool-5 IRSU Challenge was easy?

Then you would've had to do a grand tour 3 times

 

What if we discovered that the Alcubierre could actually work?

The promise of quick and easy interstellar flight would lead to more public support of the pace program, and several Warp Ships are constructed in orbit, leading to new opportunities for colonization and interstellar flight.

 

What if Hitler's forces succeeded at the battle of Kursk?
